headline: Important Backup Manager Update Info (Click to Expand)
shortDescription: The Backup manager was optimized & reworked in the latest update (v5.9) to be faster and more reliable with huge numbers of backups.
bodyHtml: Please report any anomalies or bugs you encounter either on the GitHub Issues page or on the SSUI Discord Server.
warningHtml: With this update, the Backup manager no longer supports the old (pre-terrain update) terrain and save system. Please switch to the new Terrain system if you wish to continue to use new SSUI features. Alternatively, you can continue to use the old system by using SSUI 5.8 and below, disabling auto-updates via the config.json file.
author: MensRea

headline: SSUI v5.10.1: Bugfix Patch
bodyHtml:
This is a very small patch fixing 2 bugs: - The BackendEndpointPort flag (-p) would not apply if set to 8443 - The WorldID field would not apply if used on the Terrain Settings config page → removed it from the Basic Settings, now WorldID is to be set from the wizard or the Terrain Settings page - Added a -GamePort flag to set the connection port for gameserver connections from CLI directly at startup → This was added for BadDucky52's SSUI pterodactyl egg to work as intended → This means you can now run SSUI inside pterodactyl → if you have to

In the next days / weeks, a mod support update (v5.11.0) will follow, adding
• StationeersLaunchPad install & uninstall
• SLP ModPackage Uploads
• Possibly automatic mod updates
author: JacksonTheMaster

headline: If your server won't start after updating to latest, read this
shortDescription: Quick fix for RakNet-related startup crashes (Fallback handler could not load library / DllNotFoundException) – glibc dependency issue
bodyHtml:
If your server fails to start after the recent Stationeers update and you see errors like:
• Fallback handler could not load library
• DllNotFoundException related to RakNet
• or basically any other RakNet-related crash,

this issue is related to the glibc version installed on your system.

Users report that glibc versions 2.40 and higher are required – older versions likely won't work.
Recent glibc releases:
• 2026-01-24 → GLIBC 2.43
• 2025-07-28 → GLIBC 2.42
• 2025-01-30 → GLIBC 2.41
• 2024-07-22 → GLIBC 2.40

These newer versions are currently only included in very modern Linux distributions. Examples of distros that typically ship glibc 2.40+ (or higher) include:
• Ubuntu 25.04 (Plucky Puffin) (glibc ~2.41+)
• Ubuntu 24.10 (Oracular)
• Debian 13+ (glibc ~2.41–2.43)
• Debian experimental/unstable

Older distros often have lower versions (e.g., Ubuntu 24.04 ~2.39, Debian 12 ~2.36, Ubuntu 22.04 ~2.35) and are likely affected – you may need to upgrade your OS or use a newer base image.

Possible workaround: (users had mixed success with this)

0. Update SSUI to v5.11.0 if not done already

1. Go to /setup?step=game_branch Click
2. Select "A slightly rolled back Multiplayer-Safe version"
3. Save the change
4. You can then exit the wizard immediately after saving (click the X in the top-right corner)

5. Hit the Update Server button on the main Dashboard

This switches you to a known-stable branch that avoids the current RakNet issues in the latest version. You can switch back to latest once the problem is officially fixed upstream.
author: JacksonTheMaster
